data.enText: an arm or a leg; a similar part of an animal, such as a wing

data.chText: 好一会儿她四肢都动弹不得。
data.enText: For a while, she lost the use of her limbs.
having the type of limbs mentioned
a large branch of a tree

data.chText: 你愿意冒险把你的疑团公开吗？
data.enText: Are you prepared to go out on a limb (= risk doing sth that other people are not prepared to do) and make your suspicions public?
to risk being killed or injured in order to do sth

ex.chText: 河的支流/党的支部/树的分枝
该银行在全国各地都有分行。
ex.enText: The bank has branches all over the country.

synonyms.bx: 通常指树的枝条，常用于引申意义，表示组织、学科、河流、道路等的分支。

ex.chText: 树上的一根大枝条被锯了下来。
ex.enText: A limb was sawed off from a tree.

synonyms.bx: 指大的树枝或人、动物的肢体。

ex.enText: a prong of the garden fork
the third prong of the strategy

synonyms.bx: 尤指叉子等的尖头；也指攻击、论点等的某一方面。

data.chText: 你愿意冒险把你的疑团公开吗？
data.enText: Are you prepared to go out on a limb (= risk doing sth that other people are not prepared to do) and make your suspicions public?
to risk being killed or injured in order to do sth

tr: any projection that is thought to resemble a human arm
example: the arm of the record player

tr: the graduated arc that is attached to an instrument for measuring angles
either of the two halves of a bow from handle to tip
example: the upper limb of the bow

tr: one of the jointed appendages of an animal used for locomotion or grasping: arm
(astronomy) the circumferential edge of the apparent disc of the sun or the moon or a planet
any of the main branches arising from the trunk or a bough of a tree

value.def: Your limbs are your arms and legs.

example.ex: She would be able to stretch out her cramped limbs and rest for a few hours.
example.tran: 她将能伸展一下蜷缩的四肢，休息几个小时。

value.def: The limbs of a tree are its branches.

example.ex: This entire rickety structure was hanging from the limb of an enormous leafy tree.
example.tran: 这整个快要散架的搭建物吊挂在一棵枝繁叶茂的大树的枝杈上。

value.def: If someone goes out on a limb, they do something they strongly believe in even though it is risky or extreme, and is likely to fail or be criticized by other people.

example.ex: They can see themselves going out on a limb, voting for a very controversial energy bill.
example.tran: 他们可以预见到要是给极具争议性的能源法案投赞成票，可能会陷入孤立。

value.tran: 冒着遭受失败（或指责）的风险；处于孤立无援的境地

value.def: If someone threatens to tear you limb from limb, they mean that they are extremely angry with you, and may use violence against you.

example.ex: The police were lucky they found him before I did. I would have torn him limb from limb.
example.tran: 警察很幸运，比我先找到了他。不然我真会把他大卸八块的。

trans: 幻肢(截肢者觉得肢体犹存的感觉)
